result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarvell Little was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

EACH COUNT:  Court costs, victim witness, DNA surcharge to be paid by 10/18/2033.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).   Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; and consecutive to count two.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 10-16-2015 received and filed. (45 Pages.)
Scanned Sentencing Memorandum and Court Report.vmb
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Jarvell Little in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jarvell Little in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additonal statements by Jacqueline J., Jerrell J. and Julia J.

Count 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 16 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 11 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 276 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution in the amount of $8,870.00 is to be paid to Gervonni S. by Jarvell Little; Department of Corrections balance to be paid by 10/15/2033; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment, court waives 10% surcharge.
-Restitution, court costs, victim/witness surcharges and DNA surcharges to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/18/2033; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/18/2033; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

Count 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to Count 2. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/18/2033; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/18/2033; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Anger Management Course
-No alcohol or controlled substances
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education.
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with Dante B, Jeffery S, Javon B. 
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed - Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed - Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Filed - Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed - Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Jarvell Little not in court, defendant in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing hearing, however due do pending jury trial courts grants joint request for more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 2 and 4:
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNTS 1, 3 and 5:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Counts 1, 3 and 5 DISMISSED and READ IN.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 10/2/2015 at 10:00 am in Branch 15.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jarvell Little in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Jarvell Little in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed a second amended information amending Count 2 to:
Second Degree Reckless Homicide, pursuant to Wis Stat940.06(1), a class "D" Felony.
State's Witness List filed along with the State's Requested Jury Instructions. sab
Final Pretrial held. Case calendared for DECISION and FINAL PRETRIAL on 9/4/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Jarvell Little in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin and attorney Bridget Krause.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amended information charging:
COUNT 1: Possession of a Dangerous Weapon By a Person Under 18, pursuant to Wis Stat 948.60(2)(a), a class "A" Misdemeanor
COUNT 2: First Degree Reckless Homicide, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, pursuant to Wis Stat 940.02(1), 939.50(3)(b), a Class "B" Felony
COUNT 3: First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, pursuant to Wis Stat 
941.30(1), 939.63(1)(b), a class "F" Felony
COUNT 4: Possession of Short-Barreled Shotgun or Short-Barreled Rifle, pursuant to Wis Stat 941.28(2), a class "H" Felony
COUNT 5: Possession of a Dangerous Weapon by a Person Under 18, pursuant to Wis Stat 948.60(2)(a), a class "A" Misdemeanor
Defense waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty.

Defendant Jarvell Little in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jarvell Little in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's motion to sequester witnesses granted by the court.   Defendant's motion to suppress search proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Sgt. Defendant's motion to adjourn trial not objected to by the State and granted by the court.  Case adjourned to 8-13-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for motion hearing/final pretrial and to 8-31-2015 at 10:00a.m for jury trial in Branch 6.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
